 lld_hsi2c_opMode defines operating mode of the driver More...
 
enum  LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t {
  LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS = (int32_t) 0, LLD_HSI2C_FAIL = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 1), LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS = -(int32_t) 10, LLD_HSI2C_ETIMEOUT = -(int32_t) 2,
  LLD_HSI2C_HANDLE_UNAVAIL = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 2), LLD_HSI2C_BUS_BUSY_ERR = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 3), LLD_HSI2C_ARBITRATION_LOSS_ERR = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 4), LLD_HSI2C_NACK_ERR = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 5),
  LLD_HSI2C_TRANSMIT_UNDERFLOW_ERR = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 6), LLD_HSI2C_RECEIVE_OVERFLOW_ERR = ((int32_t)HSI2C_ERROR_BASE - 7), LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_RX_PENDING = (int32_t) 1, LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_TX_PENDING = (int32_t) 2,
  LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_TRANSFER_PENDING = (int32_t) 3, LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_BUFFER_UPDATED = (int32_t) 4
}
 LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t status and error codes that are returned from LLD. More...

 EDMA transfer status. More...
 
enum  LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t { HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1, HSI2C_INST_MAX_1, HSI2C_INST_MAX }

Functions

LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_init (hsI2cObjHandle *i2cObjHandle, LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t numInstance, lld_hsi2c_initParam_t *initParams)
 lld_i2c_init() Initializes i2c instance object properties. Read the application initialization parameters & initialize the data structure. Changes the state to created after successful initialization. More...
 
hsI2cHandle lld_i2c_open (LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t instanceId, lldHsi2cAppCallback appCallback, void *appData)
 lld_i2c_open() creates the handle for I2C port for a open. There can be maximum of HSI2C_NUM_OPENS opens Initialize the hardware port & change the state to open Funtion is not Re-entrant. Please use semaphore in the application More...
 
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_transfer (hsI2cHandle handle, const lld_hsi2c_datatfr_params_t *i2cXferParams)
 lld_i2c_transfer() is used to send or receive data Data is transfered depending on the mode of operation(DMA, Interrupt or polled) Function is not Re-entrant. Please use semaphore lock in the application More...
 
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_transReceive (hsI2cHandle handle, lld_hsi2c_transreceive_params_t *i2cXferParams)
 lld_i2c_transReceive() is used to send or receive data as I2C slave. Only Interrupt mode is supported. Function is not Re-entrant. Please use semaphore lock in the application. In case any error is returned then the application should abort the transfer by calling lld_i2c_abort_transfer API. More...
 
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_close (hsI2cHandle *handle)
 lld_i2c_close() closes the handle for I2C port for a open. Decreaments number of open handles. Changes the state of object to CLOSED. Clears the handle More...

Definitions stating maximum limitations of I2C

#define HSI2C_NUM_OPENS   ((uint32_t) 4U)
 Max number of handles for each instance.
 
#define HSI2C_MIN_BUS_FREQ   ((uint32_t) 100U)
 Minimum bus frequency.
 
#define HSI2C_MAX_BUS_FREQ   ((uint32_t) 400U)
 Maximum bus frequency.
 
#define HSI2C_BUFFER_MAXLENGTH   32768
 Maximum buffer length.
 

The following flags offer the user maximum flexibility in terms

of making the right I2C transaction. In case the user does not want to set the flags on his own, the default read/write flag can be specified

#define LLD_HSI2C_READ   ((uint32_t) 0x0001U)
 Read from I2C bus (device)
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_WRITE   ((uint32_t) 0x0002U)
 Write to I2C bus (device)
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_MASTER   ((uint32_t) 0x0004U)
 Configure I2C in Master mode.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE   ((uint32_t) 0x0008U)
 Configure I2C in Slave mode.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_START   ((uint32_t) 0x0010U)
 Generate Start - valid in master mode only.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_STOP   ((uint32_t) 0x0020U)
 Generate Stop - valid in master mode only.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_RESTART   ((uint32_t) 0x0040U)
 Re-Start is generated by Master.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_REPEAT   ((uint32_t) 0x0080U)
 Repeat mode.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_IGNORE_BUS_BUSY   ((uint32_t) 0x0100U)
 Ignore Bus Busy condition.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_M_IGNORE_NAK   ((uint32_t) 0x0200U)
 Ignore NAK.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_REPEAT_TX_BUF   ((uint32_t) 0x0400U)
 Repeat TX buffer flag.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_OVERWRITE_RX_BUF   ((uint32_t) 0x0400U)
 Overwrite RX buffer flag.
 

Use these flags for simple MASTER read/write transactions on the I2C bus

#define LLD_HSI2C_DEFAULT_READ   (LLD_HSI2C_READ | LLD_HSI2C_MASTER | LLD_HSI2C_START | LLD_HSI2C_STOP)
 Default read flag.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_DEFAULT_WRITE   (LLD_HSI2C_WRITE | LLD_HSI2C_MASTER | LLD_HSI2C_START | LLD_HSI2C_STOP)
 Default write flag.
 

Local values that can be passed to hal_hsi2c_delay API

#define HSI2C_DELAY_SMALL   ((uint32_t) 5000U)
 Small delay.
 
#define HSI2C_DELAY_MED   ((uint32_t) 10000U)
 Average delay.
 
#define HSI2C_DELAY_BIG   ((uint32_t) 20000U)
 Large delay.
 
#define HSI2C_DELAY_HUGE   ((uint32_t) 50000U)
 Huge delay.
 

Error base value. All error values returned from lib are smaller than

this

#define HSI2C_ERROR_BASE   (-((int32_t) 16))
 Error base value. More...
 

Local values that can be passed to lld_hsi2c_initParam_t -> isMasterMode

Only Interrupt mode operation supported in slave trans receive

#define LLD_HSI2C_MODE_SLAVE   (0U)
 Slave Mode.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_MODE_MASTER   (1U)
 Master Mode.
 
#define LLD_HSI2C_MODE_SLAVE_TRANSRECEIVE   (2U)
 Slave Trans Receive Mode.
 

Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

#define HSI2C_ERROR_BASE   (-((int32_t) 16))

Error base value.

Note
Upto 16 are used/reserved by IOM model of SysBios

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum lld_hsi2c_opMode

lld_hsi2c_opMode defines operating mode of the driver

Enumerator
HSI2C_OPMODE_POLLED 

Polled mode operation

HSI2C_OPMODE_INTERRUPT 

Interrupt mode operation

HSI2C_OPMODE_DMA 

DMA mode of operation

enum LLD_hsi2cEdmaStatus

EDMA transfer status.

Enumerator
EDMA_TRANSFER_SUCCESS 

EDMA transfer is successful

EDMA_TRANSFER_FAIL 

EDMA transfer is failed

enum LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t

LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t status and error codes that are returned from LLD.

Enumerator
LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS 

Operation is successful

LLD_HSI2C_FAIL 

Operation failed

LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS 

Bad argument is passed Value same as IOM error IOM_EBADARGS as defined in IOM.h of SysBios

LLD_HSI2C_ETIMEOUT 

Time out occurs Value same as IOM error IOM_ETIMEOUT as defined in IOM.h of SysBios

LLD_HSI2C_HANDLE_UNAVAIL 

Handle not available

LLD_HSI2C_BUS_BUSY_ERR 

Bus is busy Returned when the I2C bus find that the bus is busy

LLD_HSI2C_ARBITRATION_LOSS_ERR 

arbitration error occurred Returned when the I2C driver lost the bus arbitration

LLD_HSI2C_NACK_ERR 

No ACK received from slave Returned when the I2C slave did not acknowledgement

LLD_HSI2C_TRANSMIT_UNDERFLOW_ERR 

transmit underflow occurred Returned in case of an transmit underflow error

LLD_HSI2C_RECEIVE_OVERFLOW_ERR 

receiver overflow occurred Returned in case of an receive overflow error

LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_RX_PENDING 

Current Transaction completed Successful but transfer is not complete. Restart received with read

LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_TX_PENDING 

Current Transaction completed Successful but transfer is not complete. Restart received with write

LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_TRANSFER_PENDING 

Transfer request is submitted but transfer not started by the external I2C master

LLD_HSI2C_SLAVE_BUFFER_UPDATED 

This status will be set by application when the buffers are updated in callback of restart condition

enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t

LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t defines I2C instances that can be selected to operated These values are passed as argument to lld_i2c_init() and lld_i2c_open fn.

Enumerator
HSI2C_INST_0 

0th instance

HSI2C_INST_1 

1st instance

HSI2C_INST_MAX_1 

Maximum instances that are supported

HSI2C_INST_MAX 

Maximum instances that are supported

enum lld_i2c_busspeed

lld_i2c_busspeed defines the I2C bus frequencies that can be operated

Enumerator
I2C_NORMAL 

I2C device operates at 100 kHz

I2C_FAST 

I2C device operates at 400 kHz

I2C_HIGH 

I2C device operates at 200000 kHz - Not supported

Function Documentation

LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_abort_transfer ( hsI2cHandle  handle)

lld_i2c_abort_transfer() aborts the ongoing transfer

Parameters
handlei2c handle
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_clockConfig ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
uint32_t  functionalClock,
lld_i2c_busspeed  busFrequency 
)

lld_i2c_clockConfig() configures I2C bus clock frequency

Note : API should be called after calling lld_i2c_open and before calling lld_i2c_transfer. This API can be used in two case

  1. If functional clock to I2C is other than that of the default functional clock used for TDA2XX(96 MHz) and TI814x(48 MHz)
  2. Changing frequency on demand without reinitializing the driver
Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
functionalClockFunctional input clock to I2C in Hz e.g. for 24 MHz input clock provide 24000000 Default functional clock used for TDA2XX is 96 MHz and for TI814x is 48 MHz
busFrequencyI2C output frequency in kbps as defined by lld_i2c_busspeed enum
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_close ( hsI2cHandle *  handle)

lld_i2c_close() closes the handle for I2C port for a open. Decreaments number of open handles. Changes the state of object to CLOSED. Clears the handle

Parameters
handlei2c handle
Returns
status status of close LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - close successful LLD_HSI2C_FAIL - close failed
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_deinit ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  numInstance)

lld_i2c_deinit() closes all the handles and clears the instance for the instance number passed

Parameters
numInstanceinstance number
Returns
status status of de initialization LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - de-initialization successful

lld_i2c_busspeed *  busFreq 
)

lld_i2c_getBusFreq() gets the current I2C bus frequency in KHz

Parameters

busFreqpointer to store the current i2c bus frequency
Returns

uint32_t *  pSc

Note : API should be called after calling lld_i2c_open and before calling lld_i2c_transfer.

Parameters

sCllpointer to sCll divider value
sClhpointer to sClh divider value
pScpointer to pSc divider value

uint32_t lld_i2c_getFclk ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId)

lld_i2c_getFclk() gets the I2C bus input clock frequency

Default functional clock used for TDA2XX is 96 MHz and TI814x is 48 MHz

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
Returns
uint32_t Functional input clock to I2C in Hz
uint32_t lld_i2c_getIclk ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId)

lld_i2c_getIclk() gets the I2C internal clock frequency

Default Internal clock used for FAST Mode is 12 MHz and NORMAL Mode is 4 MHz

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
Returns
uint32_t Internal clock to I2C in Hz.

LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_getProcessedBufLength ( hsI2cHandle  handle,
uint32_t *  validBufLength 
)

lld_i2c_getProcessedBufLength() get the number of bytes processed in the current transfer.

Note : API should be called after calling lld_i2c_transfer. This API returns the number of bytes processed (read/written) after initiating the transfer with lld_i2c_transfer. When this API is called from the application callback function, received at the end of transfer, it will return total number of bytes sent/received in the previous transfer.

Parameters
handlei2c handle.
validBufLengthpointer to get number of bytes processed.
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_init ( hsI2cObjHandle *  i2cObjHandle,
LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  numInstance,
lld_hsi2c_initParam_t *  initParams 
)

lld_i2c_init() Initializes i2c instance object properties. Read the application initialization parameters & initialize the data structure. Changes the state to created after successful initialization.

Parameters
i2cObjHandleHandle to the instance object
numInstanceInstance ID(i2c port number).
initParamsInitialization parameters.
Returns
status status of the initialization. HAL_HSI2C_SUCCESS - if initialization is successful HAL_HSI2C_FAIL - if initialization fails HAL_HSI2C_BADARGS - if wrong argument is passed
hsI2cHandle lld_i2c_open ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
lldHsi2cAppCallback  appCallback,
void *  appData 
)

lld_i2c_open() creates the handle for I2C port for a open. There can be maximum of HSI2C_NUM_OPENS opens Initialize the hardware port & change the state to open Funtion is not Re-entrant. Please use semaphore in the application

Parameters
instanceIdInstance Id(i2c port number)
appCallbackApplication call back function
appDataApplication data to be passed to call back function
Returns
hsI2cHandle valid handle is successful NULL if failed to open
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_probe ( hsI2cHandle  handle,
uint8_t  slaveAddr 
)

lld_i2c_probe() probes the i2c device for the slave address passed

Parameters
handlei2c handle
slaveAddraddress of the device to be probed
Returns
status status of probe LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS - if arguments are incorrect LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - close successful LLD_HSI2C_FAIL - close failed
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_recoverBus ( hsI2cHandle  handle,
uint32_t  i2cDelay 
)

lld_i2c_recoverBus() Generate 9 CLK pulses on SCL

Parameters
handlei2c handle
i2cDelayused as busy loop count down value to generate delay in toggelling SCL signal (high to low or low to high)
Returns
status status of probe LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS - if arguments are incorrect LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - generate clock pulse successful
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_resetCtrl ( hsI2cHandle  handle)

lld_i2c_resetCtrl() resets the i2c controller

Parameters
handlei2c handle
Returns
status status of contoller reset LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS - if arguments are incorrect LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - ctrl reset successful LLD_HSI2C_FAIL - ctrl reset failed
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_setBusFreq ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
lld_i2c_busspeed  busFreq 
)

lld_i2c_setBusFreq() sets the current I2C bus frequency in KHz.

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
busFreqi2c bus frequencyto be configured in KHz
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_setClockDiv ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
uint32_t  sCll,
uint32_t  sClh,
uint32_t  pSc 
)

lld_i2c_setClockDiv() returns I2C Clock divider values

Note : API should be called after calling lld_i2c_open and before calling lld_i2c_transfer.Normal sequence should be lld_i2c_clockConfig, lld_i2c_getClockDiv and then lld_i2c_setClockDiv

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
sCllActual sCll divider value
sClhActual sClh divider value
pScActual pSc divider value
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_setFclk ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
uint32_t  fclk 
)

lld_i2c_setFclk() sets the I2C bus input clock frequency

Note : API should be called before calling lld_i2c_open and after calling lld_i2c_init. This API can be used to specify the input functional clock to I2C. Applicationr Should take care that appropriate input clock is already provided to the I2C as part of system init. This API does not take care of checking if the input clock provided is valid

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
fclkFunctional input clock to I2C in Hz
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_SetFifoThreshold ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
uint8_t  rxThreshold,
uint8_t  txThreshold 
)

lld_i2c_SetFifoThreshold() sets the threshold value for FIFO for buffered transfer.

Note : API should be called before calling lld_i2c_open and after calling lld_i2c_init

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
rxThresholdThreshold value for Rx FIFO
txThresholdThreshold value for Tx FIFO 
     rxThreshold or txThreshold can take values 0-31 to configure FIFO
     from 1 to 32 bytes
     value 0 = 1 byte(default)
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t Status. HAL_HSI2C_SUCCESS - if success HAL_HSI2C_BADARGS - if instanceId is wrong
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_setIclk ( LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t  instanceId,
uint32_t  iclk 
)

lld_i2c_setIclk() sets the I2C Internal clock frequency

Note : API should be called before calling lld_i2c_open and after calling lld_i2c_init. This API can be used to specify the input functional clock to I2C. Applicationr Should take care that appropriate input clock is already provided to the I2C as part of system init. This API does not take care of checking if the input clock provided is valid

Parameters
instanceIdi2c instance number can be one of the following values from enum LLD_Hsi2cInstId_t HSI2C_INST_0 = 0, HSI2C_INST_1 HSI2C_INST_2 HSI2C_INST_3 HSI2C_INST_4 HSI2C_INST_5
iclkInternal clock to I2C in Hz
Returns
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS Status.
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_transfer ( hsI2cHandle  handle,
const lld_hsi2c_datatfr_params_t *  i2cXferParams 
)

lld_i2c_transfer() is used to send or receive data Data is transfered depending on the mode of operation(DMA, Interrupt or polled) Function is not Re-entrant. Please use semaphore lock in the application

Parameters
handleHandle to I2C port
i2cXferParamsData transfer parameters
Returns
status Status of transfer or error code LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - if initialization is successful LLD_HSI2C_FAIL - if initialization fails LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS - if wrong argument is passed
LLD_hsi2cErrorCode_t lld_i2c_transReceive ( hsI2cHandle  handle,
lld_hsi2c_transreceive_params_t *  i2cXferParams 
)

lld_i2c_transReceive() is used to send or receive data as I2C slave. Only Interrupt mode is supported. Function is not Re-entrant. Please use semaphore lock in the application. In case any error is returned then the application should abort the transfer by calling lld_i2c_abort_transfer API.

Parameters
handleHandle to I2C port
i2cXferParamsData transfer parameters
Returns
status Status of transfer or error code LLD_HSI2C_SUCCESS - if initialization is successful LLD_HSI2C_FAIL - if initialization fails LLD_HSI2C_BADARGS - if wrong argument is passed
